doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
Amelia Rives w/1st husband John Armstrong Chanler, w/2nd husband Pierre Troubetzkoy Home--2nd Highest house purchase in Albemarle County history = $5,535,000 1991

1 Story Frame Hall-Parlor 1764 + Brick I-House 1824, Paired Column Portico, 5 Bay, H-plan, Flemish Bond, 5 Course American Bond, Pitsaw Marks, Bulkhead, Beaded Siding, Cut Nails with Hammered Heads, 1 3/4 Wide Muntins, Interesting Mantels, Rose Head Nails, Symmetrical Trim, Rondel Blocks, 6 Panel Door, Fanlight, Triple Hung Sash Windows, 9/9, 6/6, Barred Cellar Windows, Orangeries 1844, Smokehouse/Dairy, Slave Quarters, Kitchen, Cemetery, Ghost, Centered on Mountain
John M Perry 1824--William B Phillips 1844 --Marshall Wells, Architect 1947--Floyd Johnson, Architect 1986--Anne Mark, Architect 1991
survey data: National Register of Historic Places--Virginia Landmarks Register--Architecture in Virginia --Virginia Road Traces--Work Projects Administration
